alert.note: Alert for Mesa; Montrose (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 07 at 10:51AM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON MDT MONDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by snowmelt continues. * WHERE...Portions of the Dolores River from the confluence with the San Miguel River in western Colorado to the confluence with the Colorado River in eastern Utah, including the town of Gateway, CO. * WHEN...Until noon MDT Monday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying along the Dolores River is imminent or occurring. Several low-lying river crosses and river side campgrounds may become inaccessible or inundated with water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1050 AM MDT, gage reports and forecast hydrographs indicate the Dolores River exceeding Flood stage/flow due to heavy runoff from snowmelt combined with increased releases from McPhee Reservoir. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Fisher Creek, Little Maverick Canyon, Mesa Creek, Roc Creek, Granite Creek, Salt Creek, Colorado River, West Creek, Beaver Creek, North Fork Mesa Creek, Blue Creek, John Brown Creek, Waring Canyon, Maverick Canyon and Dolores River. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Gateway. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to rising rivers, streams, or creeks as river levels often peak overnight. Please heed local advisories and closures.
